Name: Lintel and jambs of Penhasy
Description: These door parts may come from the tomb of Penhasy, possibly in Thebes. The lintel is divided into two sections: the upper register depicts a djed-pillar flanked by two jackals reclining on shrines and two udjat-eyes.The lower register is also mirrored. On the left a couple are kneeling in front of Osiris who is seated on a throne. The man is holding a standard in his left hand. On the right is same scene, this time in front of Re-Harakhty.The jambs both bear a column of text with the offering formula.
